title: Elon Musk’s robotaxi fantasy is starting to unravel
markdown_title: [Elon Musk’s robotaxi fantasy is starting to unravel](https://www.theverge.com/tesla/654253/tesla-robotaxi-elon-musk-earnings-promise-fantasy)
summary: Elon Musk has been promising to have fully autonomous Tesla vehicles on the road by the end of next year for several years. Musk has faced criticism for his overly optimistic outlook on self-driving technology and for not addressing the limitations of his own company's technology. Musk is intent on continuing to pursue the goal of deploying fully autonomous vehicles using a camera-only sensor suite and an end-to-end neural network, but he faces questions about the company's current progress and future plans. The text suggests that while Musk may be willing to continue pursuing his vision of a future-focused company producing millions of robots, it may be difficult to achieve given the current challenges facing the industry and the political landscape.

title: Tesla’s revenue and profits tank amid political chaos
markdown_title: [Tesla’s revenue and profits tank amid political chaos](https://www.theverge.com/news/653645/tesla-q1-earnings-2025-revenue-profit-elon-musk)
summary: Tesla reported a decline in revenue and profits for the first quarter, with $409 million in net income on $19.3 billion in revenue. The company's net income dropped by 71% to $409 million on $19.3 billion in revenue. Tesla acknowledged that tariffs and "changing political sentiment" will continue to complicate efforts to grow out of its current rut. The company is rethinking its 2025 guidance and will update it after next quarter.

title: Tesla Supercharger damaged in possible explosion in Washington
markdown_title: [Tesla Supercharger damaged in possible explosion in Washington](https://www.theverge.com/news/645378/tesla-supercharger-damaged-explosion-washington)
summary: A Tesla Supercharger station was severely damaged in a possible explosion in Lacey, Washington. The local police department and the FBI are investigating the incident. The company is "on site" with law enforcement and reviewing camera footage. It's the latest incident of Tesla-related vandalism following CEO Elon Musk's high-profile position in the Trump administration as the head of the Department of Government Efficiency.

title: Tesla’s latest Cybertruck has longer range and the cheapest price yet
markdown_title: [Tesla’s latest Cybertruck has longer range and the cheapest price yet](https://www.theverge.com/news/647060/tesla-cybertruck-rwd-long-lange-model-launch-entry)
summary: Tesla has released a new Cybertruck model with longer range and the cheapest price yet at $69,990 before the federal $7,500 credit. The entry-level Cybertruck has just one RWD motor instead of two in the AWD model. It also lacks a powered roll-up hard tonneau cover and a $750 fitted soft tonneau cover. The new Cybertruck can drive up to 350 miles on a charge and tow 7,500 pounds compared to 11,000 lbs on the other trims.

title: Tesla is making progress on its 1950s diner and drive-in
markdown_title: [Tesla is making progress on its 1950s diner and drive-in](https://www.theverge.com/news/653959/tesla-1950s-diner-drive-in-near-complete-los-angeles)
summary: Tesla has shared new images of its first retro drive-in location in Los Angeles. The company's CEO Elon Musk dreamt up the idea of a 1950s-themed "Tesla Diner" and Supercharger hub as far back as 2018. Last week, The Real Deal reported that Tesla is nearing completion with the diner located on Santa Monica Boulevard. Tesla got the permit for the diner seven years ago.

title: Elon Sounds Extremely Depressed After Tesla Profits Plunge 71%
markdown_title: [Elon Sounds Extremely Depressed After Tesla Profits Plunge 71%](https://gizmodo.com/elon-sounds-extremely-depressed-after-tesla-profits-plunge-71-2000593013)
summary: Tesla reported lower than expected earnings on Tuesday, with first-quarter profits dropping 71% on much lower sales of electric vehicles. Elon Musk tried to put a slightly rosier spin on the state of his EV company in an earnings call Tuesday, but still sounded very depressed. The company produced $19.3 billion in revenue in the first quarter, down 9% compared with the same period a year earlier. Deliveries of Tesla's Model 3 and Model Y were down 12%.

title: Tesla won’t have to report as many Level 2 crashes after Trump’s rule change
markdown_title: [Tesla won’t have to report as many Level 2 crashes after Trump’s rule change](https://www.theverge.com/news/657859/tesla-adas-crash-report-nhtsa-sgo-trump-musk)
summary: The US Department of Transportation announced a major change to the Biden-era rule that requires automakers and tech companies to report crashes that involve fully or partially autonomous vehicles. Under the revised rules, companies will no longer have to report certain crashes, such as those involving a vehicle equipped with a Level 2 advanced driver assist system (ADAS) that resulted in a tow-away, but no injuries, fatalities, or airbag deployments. Tesla represented the bulk of crashes reported to the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) involving vehicles with Level 2 automated systems. According to NHTSA, a total of 2,359 crashes involving vehicles equipped with ADAS were reported since the rule was first implemented in July 2021.

title: Tesla’s Cybertruck is getting deeper discounts and production cuts
markdown_title: [Tesla’s Cybertruck is getting deeper discounts and production cuts](https://www.theverge.com/news/652164/tesla-cybertruck-discounts-production-cuts-2024-foundation-series)
summary: Tesla's Cybertruck is getting deeper discounts and production cuts. Many Cybertrucks listed on Tesla's website are from 2024 model year with discounts of $10,000 or more. Some Cybertruck models won't be eligible for $7,500 federal tax credit due to their age or sticker price. Used Cybertruck prices are also taking a hit with an average used Cybertruck selling for $85,000 on CarGurus today and $104,300 and $107,800 respectively in December and November respectively.

title: Elon Musk says he’ll step back from DOGE starting in May
markdown_title: [Elon Musk says he’ll step back from DOGE starting in May](https://www.theverge.com/news/653928/elon-musk-doge-step-back-tesla-earnings)
summary: Elon Musk announced that he will step back from his work at the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) starting in May. He said that he would continue to "spend a day or two" each week on DOGE matters "probably for the remainder of the president's term," but would spend the bulk of his time focused on his electric car company. As a special advisor to the Trump administration, Musk was limited to just 130 days under the designation. Musk has been urged by Tesla investors to step down from the controversial project and focus more attention on Tesla, which is undergoing a major sales slump.

title: Now Kia EVs can use Tesla’s Superchargers
markdown_title: [Now Kia EVs can use Tesla’s Superchargers](https://www.theverge.com/news/655855/kia-tesla-supercharger-access-nacs-ev6-ev9-niro)
summary: Kia is the latest automaker to be granted Tesla Supercharger access. The news comes as Kia announces a refreshed Kia EV6 model for 2025 this week, which will come standard with a Tesla-style NACS port. Owners of current EV6, EV9, and Niro EV models can use a CCS1-to-NACS adapter, which can be purchased from Kia dealers. Some Kia EV6 and EV9 owners have previously tricked Superchargers into charging their EVs by telling the Tesla app that they are driving a Hyundai Ioniq 5.

title: Tesla whistleblower wins legal battle against Elon Musk
markdown_title: [Tesla whistleblower wins legal battle against Elon Musk](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cevdz4yxpd9o)
summary: A whistleblower named Cristina Balan has won a legal battle against Tesla and its CEO, Elon Musk. Ms. Balan raised safety concerns about the design flaw in Tesla cars in 2014. She was fired for her concerns and later won a wrongful dismissal case. The case went to arbitration but was dismissed due to California's statute of limitations.

title: As Elon Musk Torches Reputation, Tesla Sees Its Biggest Sales Decline In History
markdown_title: [As Elon Musk Torches Reputation, Tesla Sees Its Biggest Sales Decline In History](https://gizmodo.com/as-elon-musk-torches-reputation-tesla-sees-its-biggest-sales-decline-in-history-2000584080)
summary: Tesla reported its steepest sales decline in company history for the first three months of 2025. The decline was expected due to Europe's poor performance and Tesla's temporary closure of factories to update production lines for the new Model Y. Some buyers held off while waiting for the updated version of the most popular car to become available. On Tuesday, Electrek reported that Tesla currently has $200 million worth of Cybertrucks sitting unsold in its inventory.

title: How Biden Set Up Trump to Use Authoritarian Tactics on Tesla Protesters
markdown_title: [How Biden Set Up Trump to Use Authoritarian Tactics on Tesla Protesters](https://gizmodo.com/how-biden-set-trump-up-to-use-authoritarian-tactics-on-tesla-protesters-2000588237)

The full scale of the program is not publicly known and there are concerns about a secret program that spies on Americans and treats them like terrorists.

title: Tesla Halts Sales of Model S and X in China as Tariffs Take a Toll
markdown_title: [Tesla Halts Sales of Model S and X in China as Tariffs Take a Toll](https://gizmodo.com/tesla-halts-sales-of-model-s-and-x-in-china-as-tariffs-take-a-toll-2000588193)
summary: Tesla has stopped taking orders for its high-end Model S and Model X vehicles in China because the company imports those into the market. The more affordable Model 3 and Model Y vehicles are not impacted by that country's 125% tariffs implemented in the ongoing trade war. Being so close to President Trump has been something of a double-edged sword for CEO Elon Musk. While he appears to be lining up lucrative contracts for his empire of businesses, Musk's global reach makes him highly exposed to geopolitical feuds and an easy target in scuffles with adversaries.

The DOGE has not achieved its expected savings and policies like the "5 things" email have fallen by the wayside. The agency has faced legal challenges and chaos since it was created, with no clear leadership or direction. The DOGE has failed to meet its promises of cutting $2 trillion in federal spending and revising down its cuts to $1 trillion and now $150 billion.

title: Tesla bull Dan Ives has drastically cut his price target for Tesla, calling it a 'political symbol'
markdown_title: [Tesla bull Dan Ives has drastically cut his price target for Tesla, calling it a 'political symbol'](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-dan-ives-wedbush-price-target-cut-2025-4)
summary: Dan Ives, a long time bullish analyst for Tesla, has drastically cut his price target for the company from $550 to $315. The reason for the cut is that Tesla has become a political symbol globally and has lost 10% of its future global customer base due to "self-created brand issues." President Donald Trump's new tariffs on Chinese goods are likely to impact Tesla's sales in the key EV market. Early Tesla investor Ross Gerber has also expressed concerns about the company's decline and potential for a "brutal year ahead" if Elon Musk does not exit stage left or take a step back on DOGE.

title: Tesla could save itself from a tailspin in sales and shares — by learning from airline disasters

summary: Elon Musk has alienated the eco-conscious customer base who would buy Teslas by his involvement with DOGE and political activities. The company could rebrand by removing Musk, changing its name, and scrapping Cybertrucks to leave its past behind and attract new customers. "Tesla is more politically skewed than any other brand, and it is clearly skewed liberal," David J. Reibstein, Professor of Marketing at The Wharton School, told Business Insider. The company has reported a 13% drop in quarterly sales in the US between January and March compared to the same period in 2024 and lost more than 40% of its sales in Europe between January and February compared to the same two months last year.

Prominent investors have called for Musk to step away from Tesla, even as the CEO pledges to spend less time with the Department of Government Efficiency and more time at the car maker starting in May. BYD has reported record overseas sales for the third time this year as it expands aggressively in international markets. High tariffs prevent Tesla from selling its cars in the US, but it is gaining market share in China by undercutting BYD on price and overtaking it on innovation. Tesla's stock price has fallen since hitting a high in December due to concerns over Elon Musk's involvement with DOGE.

summary: Tesla launched the Cybertruck in 2023 and it quickly became a status symbol with Kim Kardashian, Pharrell Williams, and Justin Bieber riding around in it. Less than two years later, the waitlist has disappeared and trucks are piling up in sales lots. Over the past few months, Tesla has moved to position the Cybertruck as a working man's vehicle - less DeLorean, more Ford F-150. The company updated its website, ditching an other-worldly aesthetic for images that feature the truck hauling equipment and an Airstream trailer.

title: Why Elon Musk is breaking with Donald Trump over tariffs
markdown_title: [Why Elon Musk is breaking with Donald Trump over tariffs](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-donald-trump-tariffs-opposition-tesla-china-byd-2025-4)

Musk has made a personal appeal to Trump over the weekend to reverse his tariff plan, without success. Musk has been a longtime opponent of tariffs, even when they benefit his businesses.

In 2020, The Boring Company moved its headquarters from California to Texas, followed by Tesla in 2021 and X and SpaceX in 2024. His smaller companies, Neuralink and X.AI also have ties to Texas.

title: The rise of the Tesla Takedown: How anger at Elon Musk boiled over into a global protest movement
markdown_title: [The rise of the Tesla Takedown: How anger at Elon Musk boiled over into a global protest movement](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-takedown-protests-origin-story-history-elon-musk-2025-4)
summary: The anti-Tesla movement started with a Bluesky post and an 80s actor. Alex Winter messaged Joan Donovan on Bluesky and asked her if creating a website to centralize the protest effort would be a good idea. Two weeks after the website launched, more than 1,000 people turned out for a Tesla protest in Los Angeles. By the end of March, protests in more than 250 US cities and in 13 countries had thrust the anger with Musk into the zeitgeist.

title: Tesla sales slump in California even as car buying surges ahead of tariffs
markdown_title: [Tesla sales slump in California even as car buying surges ahead of tariffs](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-sales-california-pre-tariff-data-2025-4)
summary: Tesla's sales in California have been declining for the sixth straight quarter, even as overall new car registrations in the state saw a boost ahead of anticipated tariffs. The decline is attributed to the company's aging lineup and outpacing by competitors. Elon Musk's relationship with California has soured in recent years, with Democratic leaders clashing with him publicly and voters lean blue. In March, Tesla vehicles made up 1.4% of all trade-ins in California, up from just 0.4% a year earlier.

title: 4 Tesla owners share what it's like owning the EV among Musk backlash and protests
markdown_title: [4 Tesla owners share what it's like owning the EV among Musk backlash and protests](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-owners-fears-elon-musk-backlash-2025-4)
summary: Ben Baker sold his Cybertruck because of concerns about bullying from anti-Tesla protestors. Another owner told Business Insider they sold company shares but kept the car. Three other owners said they don't plan to get rid of their vehicles, despite the rise in anti-Tesla sentiment. One owner returned his Cybertruck because his daughter was worried about getting bullied.

title: DOGE's deepest cuts to federal jobs are still to come — with or without Elon Musk
markdown_title: [DOGE's deepest cuts to federal jobs are still to come — with or without Elon Musk](https://www.businessinsider.com/elon-musk-leaving-doge-firings-rifs-trump-federal-workforce-cuts-2025-4)
summary: Elon Musk is leaving the DOGE office to focus on Tesla in May. The first era of DOGE firings continues to face legal challenges, but the next set could be on stronger footing due to the offer of buyout-like deferred resignation plans for workers to voluntarily quit in exchange for months of paid administrative leave. Federal worker unions have vowed to fight back against the new round of reductions and are expecting more intense opposition from their members. The DOGE ethos is alive and well in the federal government, with or without Musk, and the next round of firings could be more targeted and less susceptible to litigation.

title: Federal workers aren't sure if Elon Musk is done with DOGE — but they hope they're done with '5 bullets' emails

Some express concern over reports that DOGE and Musk have access to sensitive information like internal government databases and Americans' Social Security details.

title: Why Tesla needs a different kind of CEO
markdown_title: [Why Tesla needs a different kind of CEO](https://www.businessinsider.com/why-tesla-needs-tim-cook-musk-bored-ceo-apple-jobs-2025-4)
summary: Tesla may need a new CEO who can focus on refining and scaling its electric vehicle production, as Elon Musk has shown more interest in inventing new things. This potential change has led some to compare it to Apple's transition from Steve Jobs to Tim Cook, who perfected the smartphone over and over again. A supply chain expert like Cook could help Tesla reach new heights by fine-tuning its manufacturing and sales processes. However, it remains to be seen whether Musk would be willing to relinquish control of the company he founded.

title: VW has overtaken Tesla as Europe's top EV seller
markdown_title: [VW has overtaken Tesla as Europe's top EV seller](https://www.businessinsider.com/volkswagen-overtakes-tesla-europe-top-ev-seller-elon-musk-2025-4)
summary: Volkswagen has overtaken Tesla as the top EV seller in Europe for the first three months of the year. VW's EV registrations more than doubled year-over-year to 65,679 in the first quarter, while Tesla saw its registrations drop 38% to 53,237. Battery EVs accounted for 16.9% of total car registrations in March compared to 16.9% in 2024. Despite the decline, Tesla's Model Y and Model 3 remain the top two most-registered battery EVs in Europe.

title: A lawsuit accuses Tesla of juicing odometers. So do these drivers.
markdown_title: [A lawsuit accuses Tesla of juicing odometers. So do these drivers.](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-lawsuit-odometer-fraud-inaccurate-mileage-warranty-void-2025-4)
summary: A lawsuit accuses Tesla of manipulating mileage on its electric vehicles to more quickly void its warranties. Other Tesla drivers have reported seeing significant differences between how much they say they drive and what shows up on the odometer. The class action suit filed by Nyree Hinton alleges that Tesla uses algorithms and energy consumption metrics to manipulate and misrepresent the actual mileage traveled by Tesla vehicles. It's unclear how many Tesla drivers have noticed similar gaps or whether it constitutes a pattern.

title: In the Nevada desert, a Tesla cofounder digs deep for the new black gold
markdown_title: [In the Nevada desert, a Tesla cofounder digs deep for the new black gold](https://www.businessinsider.com/redwood-materials-jb-straubel-evs-batteries-new-black-gold-tesla-2025-4)
summary: Redwood Materials, a Tesla co-founder and investor, is building North America's biggest battery recycling operation in the Nevada desert. The company currently recycles more than 70% of all lithium-ion batteries in North America and is working on combining the base ingredients of old batteries to create new black gold known as Cathode Active Material (CAM). The process involves heating old batteries to extract valuable base metals and then combining them into CAM. The company has raised $2 billion from investors and is expected to be able to execute on its ambitious project by partnering with experienced executives and having the trust of governments.

title: These 6 Chinese EVs are giving Tesla a headache in Europe
markdown_title: [These 6 Chinese EVs are giving Tesla a headache in Europe](https://www.businessinsider.com/6-chinese-evs-giving-tesla-a-headache-in-europe-2025-4)
summary: Tesla's sales have dropped by 37% in Europe in the first three months of the year as it struggles with a global brand crisis and new competitors. Chinese automakers like BYD are expanding rapidly overseas, particularly in Europe. The Seal U hybrid SUV sold by BYD has sold around 12,400 units this year with over half of those sales coming in the past month. The all-electric Dolphin made its European debut in 2023 and has sold 4,500 units so far in 2025 with a 175% increase from the same period last year.

markdown_title: [Tesla adds over a thousand workers to jumpstart Semi truck production](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-ramps-up-hiring-for-semi-truck-2025-4)

On its website, Tesla lists more than 80 manufacturing roles for the development of the Semi, from test and service technician roles to engineering and quality assurance positions. Elon Musk first unveiled the Tesla Semi in 2017 and estimated that the truck would go into mass production in 2019.

title: This $235,000 Porsche hybrid is the super sedan I'd buy over a Tesla or Lucid
markdown_title: [This $235,000 Porsche hybrid is the super sedan I'd buy over a Tesla or Lucid](https://www.businessinsider.com/porsche-panamera-turbo-e-hybrid-review-ev-range-tech-v8-2025-4)

Unfortunately, supercar performance comes with supercar prices and the base model starts at $195,700 while the range-topping Turbo S E-Hybrid requires $226,500. The design of the Panamera has been refined to feel sleeker and more elegant without compromising headroom. Upfront, the biggest change was the new LED Matrix headlights which automatically adjust illumination based on navigation data, vehicle speed, and the front-facing camera to avoid blinding oncoming drivers.

title: Tesla drops Cybertruck production targets and moves some workers off the line, employees say
markdown_title: [Tesla drops Cybertruck production targets and moves some workers off the line, employees say](https://www.businessinsider.com/tesla-cybertruck-production-drops-sales-slump-2025-4)
summary: Tesla is reducing Cybertruck production and reallocating some staff to Model Y lines, workers say. The company has dropped production targets for several Cybertruck lines over the past few months, two workers with knowledge of the targets told Business Insider. Since January, the carmaker has continued to move some workers from the line for the Cybertruck, which is made at its Texas Gigafactory, to the Model Y line, four workers said. Tesla sales more broadly have been trending downward.

title: Tesla used vehicle prices are tumbling, another worrying sign for the EV maker
markdown_title: [Tesla used vehicle prices are tumbling, another worrying sign for the EV maker](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/tesla-used-vehicle-prices-are-tumbling-another-worrying-sign-for-the-ev-maker-161433870.html)
summary: Tesla used car prices dropped 10.1% in March year over year, the biggest drop among the 10 auto brands that saw falling values in 1- to 5-year-old cars per new report from auto research site iSeeCars. Four Teslas featured prominently on the list of top 20 models with the largest price drops, with the Model S sedan having the biggest year-over-year price drop at 17.2% or nearly $10,000 from a year ago. Price cuts over the years for new Tesla EVs have weighed heavily on the used car market, as buyers were getting better value by buying new. And while that boosted new car sales, it crushed existing Tesla owners who were getting far less at trade-in and put the hurt on fleet operators like rental car chains.

title: Tesla Stock Price Reaches ‘Death Cross’ Status
markdown_title: [Tesla Stock Price Reaches ‘Death Cross’ Status](https://gizmodo.com/tesla-stock-price-reaches-death-cross-status-2000589799)
summary: Tesla's stock price has reached "death cross" status, which is an indicator of a likely downturn for the company. The "death cross" has been hitting major players like Tesla and other companies due to tariff trouble. The "death cross" is not a reliable indicator and it can mark the worst points for the index rather than a harbinger of a steeper decline. Analysts do not consider death crosses as reliable indicators and they are more often used as a harbinger of a steep decline rather than a harbinger of a steep decline.

summary: Elon claims that Tesla FSD can do 10 thousand miles without needing intervention roughly once every year. title: Elon Musk makes controversial decision that could cost Tesla big time
markdown_title: [Elon Musk makes controversial decision that could cost Tesla big time](https://www.thestreet.com/technology/elon-musk-makes-controversial-decision-that-could-cost-tesla-big-time)
summary: Elon Musk has been a controversial figure in the electric vehicle (EV) industry, known for his unconventional leadership choices and lack of regard for ethical business practices. The Tesla CEO has faced accusations from major tech rivals over his decision to prioritize self-driving technology over more affordable daily driver EVs and ignore internal warnings about the potential impact on the company. A new report suggests that Musk's decision to focus on the Cybercab at the expense of the $25,000 Tesla Model 2 may have been ill-advised and could cost Tesla big time. Internal analysts at Tesla warned Musk that the robotaxi "might never be profitable," and could negatively impact the company in the long run.

title: DOJ Charges New Mexico Man With Arson Against Tesla Showroom and Republican HQ
markdown_title: [DOJ Charges New Mexico Man With Arson Against Tesla Showroom and Republican HQ](https://gizmodo.com/doj-charges-new-mexico-man-with-arson-against-tesla-showroom-and-republican-hq-2000589339)
summary: Jamison R. Wagner was arrested on Monday and charged with arson for allegedly setting fires at a Tesla showroom in Albuquerque and the local Republican Party headquarters. The DOJ alleges that Wagner damaged two Tesla vehicles at the Tesla Showroom in Albuquerque during the early morning hours of Feb 9, 2025, one of which appears to have significant damage and another simply has a window smashed. An "intact glass container" was found in the second vehicle "containing an improvised napalm material." The building of the Tesla Showroom and six other vehicles on the property were hit with graffiti reading "Die Elon," "Tesla Nazi Inc," and "Die Tesla Nazi," as well as swastikas.

title: How Tesla Is Replacing the Age-Old Can Bus
markdown_title: [How Tesla Is Replacing the Age-Old Can Bus](https://www.notateslaapp.com/news/2645/how-tesla-is-replacing-the-age-old-can-bus)
summary: Tesla is replacing the CAN Bus with a new network technology that is more efficient and reliable. The previous CAN system is limited to 1Mbps and 8Mbps respectively, which is not sufficient for modern data-driven vehicles. The new network technology uses TDMA (Time Division Multiple Access) to ensure access to each node or data point without interference. The new network operates in repeating cycles and assigns specific time slots to avoid collisions between messages.

title: Tesla celebrates key milestone for 4680 battery cell production cost
markdown_title: [Tesla celebrates key milestone for 4680 battery cell production cost](https://www.teslarati.com/tesla-milestone-4680-battery-cell/)
summary: Tesla's Texas manufacturing team has scaled production enough to outpace the cost-effectiveness of outside suppliers for 4680 battery cells. The company's in-house 4680 battery cells have become the lowest cost per kWh battery cell producer for Tesla. Musk pointed out during the meeting that the achievement is particularly impressive given that many of the company's suppliers dedicate all or most of their businesses to battery cell manufacturing, while Tesla focuses on several other business sectors and still managed to surpass the milestone. 2025 will have more big milestones with fully ramped dry battery electrode manufacturing to deliver even more cost efficiency.
